Question.Subject: Which is better? Internet explorer, google chrome, or firefox?
Question.Content: Which is fastest and the most reliable? I don't want it to slow my laptop down
Question.ChosenAnswer:
For me the differences are too little to worry about. My preference has been Firefox for years! I have a Mac and a PC, I got used to Safari on the Mac and when Safari 4 came out I added it to my PC. I like Safari. They claim to be the fastest but I prefer FF for work and Safari for research and storing data. http://www.apple.com/safari/download/
Here are some links to some speed tests: http://www.howtocreate.co.uk/browserSpeed.html#winspeed http://www.legitreviews.com/article/929/1/
I like IE least of all but it is much better today than 4 or 5 years ago!

Answer.Content: Google Chrome is the fastest and loads youtube videos faster and is the smallest of the 3
Google Chrome is the fastest browser of the three you have listed, and will most certainly not slow your laptop down. :)

For me the differences are too little to worry about. My preference has been Firefox for years! I have a Mac and a PC, I got used to Safari on the Mac and when Safari 4 came out I added it to my PC. I like Safari. They claim to be the fastest but I prefer FF for work and Safari for research and storing data. http://www.apple.com/safari/download/
Here are some links to some speed tests: http://www.howtocreate.co.uk/browserSpeed.html#winspeed http://www.legitreviews.com/article/929/1/
I like IE least of all but it is much better today than 4 or 5 years ago!

Chrome is probably fastest, but not everyone likes it.
Firefox is the second most popular, quite quick and secure, with loads of useful plug-ins that enable you to customise it to you heart's content.
IE might be the most used browser, but that's a majority that doesn't know that it is probably the least secure and standards compliant [1].
It's also worth considering Opera [2]. One of the people on the tech mailing list I'm on that uses it describes it as Firefox with all the plug-in versatility as standard. I suspect I'm just being lazy still using Firefox because it's what comes as standard with my Ubuntu [3] install.
PS. Most browsers are available for most operating systems, but you might get better answers if you specify.
